content: Hey @T-lang -- our planning meeting starts in ~20 minutes. hackmd here. I'm going to be filling in a few things and a light agenda (running slow today, I had hoped to have this done in the morning but stuff came up).
If anybody wants, I'm just hanging out in the zoom
OK @T-lang planning meeting starting now
omg, we need this for our meetings!

https://twitter.com/shanselman/status/1357036562077241344?s=20

My Teams meetings always end SO awkwardly and it's not clear when to leave. So I made live end credits. (no post credits scene) https://twitter.com/shanselman/status/1357036562077241344/video/1

- Scott Hanselman (@shanselman)
https://www.reddit.com/r/MechanicalKeyboards/comments/l7to85/singlebutton_keyboard_gives_the_satisfaction_of_a/
this way everyone hears you leave with a clack

Hey @T-lang -- reminder that Wednesday is our next monthly planning meeting. I'm going to try and update how we track our active projects but I haven't quite gotten to it today. Nonetheless, I'd like to encourage each group to give a kind of status update.
Hopefully later today I will carve some time to rejigger and send out reminders to specific folks
OK, I didn't get to that yesterday yet--- but here is a hackmd where folks can drop updates for now
Hey @T-lang -- planning meeting in 20 minutes. Please add notes to the [hackmd] for any projects you liaison for. I've been super busy this week and haven't had time to reorganize things.
am I in the wrong zoom?
there's a oom on the invite
it may be a special one, I forget
@T-lang planning meeting now!
On my way
@pnkfelix able to attend? :point_up:
omw
Oh @T-lang I realized I didn't give a @WG-ffi-unwind update: here's some notes

Hey @T-lang -- I created a hackmd for the planning meeting tomorrow. I have listed all the projects on the project board and pinged folks to request updates in the appropriate tracking issues. In some cases I replaced the dedicated project issues with tracking issues, but there are still some dedicated project issues where I couldn't decide what to use instead.
Don't forget to open design meeting proposals if you have any!

I've been hesitating on opening a meeting about never type fwiw, but if there was one it'd be mostly to discuss that we're good with the proposed plan -- I am leaning towards a brief discussion perhaps after update tomorrow, and likely a full RFC after some experimentation with crater.
That sounds like it might not need a design meeting; it may just need a status update with a note that we'll want to review the RFC when ready.
Doing that during the project status updates sounds good to me.
I’m getting vaccinated today; I’m hoping I will be back before the design meeting starts, but I’m not yet certain that I will be back in time.
Hmm
I just discovered that my calendar had the wrong times for the Rust Verification Workshop and I will not be able to attend the meeting today either
@T-lang I propose we move the planning meeting till next week
If it were just me missing, that'd be one thing, but me and @pnkfelix seems like too much
sounds good to me!
I'll update the calendar
No objections here. So, no meeting today at all then?
Correct
Hey @T-lang -- quick reminder that the planning meeting will take place in ~20 minutes
hackmd agenda is here
If any folks have topics they'd like to raise, let me know
@Esteban Küber are you around?
Yes
Did you want to talk about generators at all?
not the technical details
we could just talk about the design meeting, project, etc I mean
not sure if you would be available to attend
@rylev do you plan to attend? any thoughts on https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/65, I forget how much we covered that already-- i feel like we did?
What's the venue for t-lang? zoom, right?
correct
the link is in the lang-team calendar but I can send it to you
I was assuming that after we get through planning the design meetings for the month, and doing status updates, that may be all the time we have.
I'd love to see a full design meeting talking about generators and the plans for them, including how we get to stable generators.
@nikomatsakis I wasn't planning on joining, but I can if need be. I think it was a final confirmation that we wanted to make this lints errors and not deny-by-default lints
I think that's roughly right

Josh Triplett said:

I'd love to see a full design meeting talking about generators and the plans for them, including how we get to stable generators.

this was the main thing I wanted to discuss-- @Esteban Küber has been thinking about this, and I wanted to discuss if we should schedule such a meeting
honestly, I'm not sure that @Esteban Küber is needed :)
I'll just added it to the list as a candidate
It probably will help for me to be there, at least just as a listener to know quickly what everybody thinks
opened https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/92
@Esteban Küber For my part, I'm really excited about the future possibilities of writing generators to produce iterators or async iterators (streams).
@rylev I don't think you are necessarily needed
always welcome, but not needed
I'll probably skip this time, and just make sure to read the notes (or watch the recording) after.
I feel like I must have the wrong zoom link (again?)
@T-lang planning meeting starting now!
Hey @T-lang -- planning meeting today!
(now)
plan is to just schedule meetings, not go over updates
https://hackmd.io/AhI3bXCHQ5GFg5w6JKxD7w
Also note that this is a different zoom link =)
OK! That was quick:

• May 12: Generators planning
  • May 19: May updates
  • May 26: Rust language "guiding principles" #91
And @Esteban Küber, @Taylor Cramer would like to discuss generators a bit beforehand :)
Hey @T-lang -- monthly planning meeting today
https://hackmd.io/C0jvelJoQX2T9N5HLP2pCw
Hey @T-lang -- we have the monthly planning meeting today. The agenda is here -- this is a bit rough, I have to improve the script, so e.g. it doesn't include all active initiatives etc.
Last chance to create a new design meetings
/me rushes off
@nikomatsakis Would the Candidate Target Policy potentially make a good design meeting conversation, or would that best be discussed in another forum?
Remind me what that is :)
Policy for targets that aren't ready to be added but are ready to start coordinating names and properties and figure out if they're suitable.
https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/3145
(Too late for this month, I think.)
OK @T-lang planning meeting starting T-5 minutes ago!
We couldn’t open the Zoom for the link from calendar, so here’s a fresh link for the August planning meeting https://us06web.zoom.us/j/82181419494
Blog post PR at https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/885 . @pnkfelix or @simulacrum, can you merge?

Hey @Josh Triplett , I have action item to schedule the upcoming lang team design meetings. But we usually include a Zoom link on those. Should we look into figuring out how to broaden the permissions on the account Niko is using for those?
In the meantime, I’ll go ahead and schedule events and ask Niko to make the invites.
oh, actually, I don’t think I have permissions to modify that calendar. Or at least, I’m only subscribed to it. I don’t see a way to request administrative access to it.
@pnkfelix I think the zoom invite is always just a duplicate of the hold slot anyway
fair enough. The bigger issue is lack of permissions on the calendar itself. But maybe its deliberate to keep that capability in the hands of the team co-leads.

I have permission to the calendar. I don't think that permission is intended to be just for the team leads; on the contrary, I think it's perfectly reasonable for team members to have write access to the team calendar.

Separate from that, we could always talk about trying something other than zoom again, because this seems like an unnecessary limitation of zoom that we need someone's paid account to create a functional meeting.
Is there a reason Zoom doesn't work though? We have the meeting already generated; it should be a matter of copy/pasting the link from any of the invites.
Niko or whoever the meeting is owned by can adjust the settings to not require the host to be present to start it.
If we're reusing the same meeting link for each meeting, that could potentially work, yes.
(we are)
